00062 /******************************************************************************

00066 #if SIZE_INFRAME_Q > 0
00067 static frameInfo_t   sInFrameQ[SIZE_INFRAME_Q];
00068 #else
00069 static frameInfo_t  *sInFrameQ = NULL;
00070 #endif  /* SIZE_INFRAME_Q > 0 */
00071 
00072 static frameInfo_t   sOutFrameQ[SIZE_OUTFRAME_Q];
00073

00086 /******************************************************************************
00087 * @fn          nwk_QInit
00088 * 
00089 * @brief     Initialize the input and output frame queues to hold no packets. 
00090 * 
00091 * input parameters
00092 * 
00093 * output parameters
00094 * 
00095 * @return   void
00096 */
00097 void nwk_QInit(void)
00098 {
00099 #if SIZE_INFRAME_Q > 0
00100   memset(sInFrameQ, 0, sizeof(sInFrameQ));
00101 #endif  // SIZE_INFRAME_Q > 0
00102   memset(sOutFrameQ, 0, sizeof(sOutFrameQ));
00103 }
00104  
00105 /******************************************************************************
00106  * @fn          nwk_QfindSlot
00107  *
00108  * @brief       Finds a slot to use to retrieve the frame from the radio. It
00109  *              uses a LRU cast-out scheme. It is possible that this routine
00110  *              finds no slot. This can happen if the queue is of size 1 or 2
00111  *              and the Rx interrupt occurs during a retrieval call from an
00112  *              application. There are meta-states for frames as the application
00113  *              looks for the oldest frame on the port being requested.
00114  *
00115  *              This routine is running in interrupt context.
00116  *
00117  * input parameters
00118  * @param   which   - INQ or OUTQ to search
00119  *
00120  * output parameters
00121  *
00122  * @return      Pointer to oldest available frame in the queue
00123  */
00124 frameInfo_t *nwk_QfindSlot(uint8_t which)
00125 {
00126   frameInfo_t *pFI, *oldest= 0, *newFI = 0;
00127   uint8_t        i, num, newOrder = 0, orderTest;
00128 
00129   if (INQ == which)
00130   {
00131     pFI  = sInFrameQ;
00132     num  = SIZE_INFRAME_Q;
00133   }
00134   else
00135   {
00136     pFI  = sOutFrameQ;
00137     num  = SIZE_OUTFRAME_Q;
00138   }
00139 
00140   orderTest = num + 1;
00141 
00142   for (i=0; i<num; ++i, ++pFI)
00143   {
00144     /* if frame is available it's a candidate. */
00145     if (pFI->fi_usage != FI_AVAILABLE)
00146     {
00147       if (INQ == which)  /* TODO: do cast-out for Tx as well */
00148       {
00149 
00150         /* need to know the number of occupied slots so we know the age value
00151          * for the unoccupied slot (if there is one).
00152          */
00153         newOrder++;
00154 
00155         /* make sure nwk_retrieveFrame() is not processing this frame */
00156         if (FI_INUSE_TRANSITION == pFI->fi_usage)
00157         {
00158           continue;
00159         }
00160         /* is this frame older than any we've seen? */
00161         if (orderTest > pFI->orderStamp)
00162         {
00163           /* yes. */
00164           oldest    = pFI;
00165           orderTest = pFI->orderStamp;
00166         }
00167       }
00168     }
00169     else
00170     {
00171       if (OUTQ == which)  /* TODO: do cast-out for Tx as well */
00172       {
00173         return pFI;
00174       }
00175       newFI = pFI;
00176     }
00177   }
00178 
00179   /* did we find anything? */
00180   if (!newFI)
00181   {
00182     /* queue was full. cast-out happens here...unless... */
00183     if (!oldest)
00184     {
00185       /* This can happen if the queue is only of size 1 or 2 and all
00186        * the frames are in transition when the Rx interrupt occurs.
00187        */
00188       return (frameInfo_t *)0;
00189     }
00190     newFI = oldest;
00191     nwk_QadjustOrder(which, newFI->orderStamp);
00192     newFI->orderStamp = i;
00193   }
00194   else
00195   {
00196     /* mark the available slot. */
00197     newFI->orderStamp = ++newOrder;
00198   }
00199 
00200   return newFI;
00201 }
00202 
00203 /******************************************************************************
00204  * @fn          nwk_QadjustOrder
00205  *
00206  * @brief       Adjusts the age of everyone in the queue newer than the frame
00207  *              being removed.
00208  *
00209  * input parameters
00210  * @param   which   - INQ or OUTQ to adjust
00211  * @param   stamp   - value of frame being removed
00212  *
00213  * output parameters
00214  *
00215  * @return      void
00216  */
00217 void nwk_QadjustOrder(uint8_t which, uint8_t stamp)
00218 {
00219   frameInfo_t *pFI;
00220   uint8_t      i, num;
00221   bspIState_t  intState;
00222 
00223   if (INQ == which)
00224   {
00225     pFI  = sInFrameQ;
00226     num  = SIZE_INFRAME_Q;
00227   }
00228   else
00229   {
00230 /*    pFI  = sOutFrameQ; */
00231 /*    num  = SIZE_OUTFRAME_Q; */
00232     return;
00233   }
00234 
00235   BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(intState);
00236 
00237   for (i=0; i<num; ++i, ++pFI)
00238   {
00239     if ((pFI->fi_usage != FI_AVAILABLE) && (pFI->orderStamp > stamp))
00240     {
00241       pFI->orderStamp--;
00242     }
00243   }
00244 
00245   BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(intState);
00246 
00247   return;
00248 }
00249 
00250 /******************************************************************************
00251  * @fn          nwk_QfindOldest
00252  *
00253  * @brief       Look through frame queue and find the oldest available frame
00254  *              in the context in question. Supports connection-based (user),
00255  *              non-connection based (NWK applications), and the special case
00256  *              of store-and-forward.
00257  *
00258  * input parameters
00259  * @param   which      - INQ or OUTQ to adjust
00260  * @param   rcvContext - context information for finding the oldest
00261  * @param   usage      - normal usage or store-and-forward usage
00262  *
00263  * output parameters
00264  *
00265  * @return      Pointer to frame that is the oldsest on the requested port, or
00266  *              0 if there are none.
00267  */
00268 frameInfo_t *nwk_QfindOldest(uint8_t which, rcvContext_t *rcv, uint8_t fi_usage)
00269 {
00270   uint8_t      i, oldest, num, port;
00271   uint8_t      uType, addr12Compare;
00272   bspIState_t  intState;
00273   frameInfo_t *fPtr = 0, *wPtr;
00274   connInfo_t  *pCInfo = 0;
00275   uint8_t     *pAddr1, *pAddr2, *pAddr3 = 0;
00276 
00277   if (INQ == which)
00278   {
00279     wPtr   = sInFrameQ;
00280     num    = SIZE_INFRAME_Q;
00281     oldest = SIZE_INFRAME_Q+1;
00282   }
00283   else
00284   {
00285 /*    pFI  = sOutFrameQ; */
00286 /*    num  = SIZE_OUTFRAME_Q; */
00287     return 0;
00288   }
00289 
00290   if (RCV_APP_LID == rcv->type)
00291   {
00292     pCInfo = nwk_getConnInfo(rcv->t.lid);
00293     if (!pCInfo)
00294     {
00295       return (frameInfo_t *)0;
00296     }
00297     port   = pCInfo->portRx;
00298     pAddr2 = pCInfo->peerAddr;
00299   }
00300   else if (RCV_NWK_PORT == rcv->type)
00301   {
00302     port = rcv->t.port;
00303   }
00304 #ifdef ACCESS_POINT
00305   else if (RCV_RAW_POLL_FRAME == rcv->type)
00306   {
00307     port   = *(MRFI_P_PAYLOAD(rcv->t.pkt)+F_APP_PAYLOAD_OS+M_POLL_PORT_OS);
00308     pAddr2 = MRFI_P_SRC_ADDR(rcv->t.pkt);
00309     pAddr3 = MRFI_P_PAYLOAD(rcv->t.pkt)+F_APP_PAYLOAD_OS+M_POLL_ADDR_OS;
00310   }
00311 #endif
00312   else
00313   {
00314     return (frameInfo_t *)0;
00315   }
00316 
00317   uType = (USAGE_NORMAL == fi_usage) ? FI_INUSE_UNTIL_DEL : FI_INUSE_UNTIL_FWD;
00318 
00319   for (i=0; i<num; ++i, ++wPtr)
00320   {
00321 
00322     BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(intState);   /* protect the frame states */
00323 
00324     /* only check entries in use and waiting for this port */
00325     if (uType == wPtr->fi_usage)
00326     {
00327       wPtr->fi_usage = FI_INUSE_TRANSITION;
00328 
00329       BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(intState);  /* release hold */
00330       /* message sent to this device? */
00331       if (GET_FROM_FRAME(MRFI_P_PAYLOAD(&wPtr->mrfiPkt), F_PORT_OS) == port)
00332       {
00333         /* Port matches. If the port of interest is a NWK applicaiton we're a
00334          * match...the NWK applications are not connection-based. If it is a
00335          * NWK application we need to check the source address for disambiguation.
00336          * Also need to check source address if it's a raw frame lookup (S&F frame)
00337          */
00338         if (RCV_APP_LID == rcv->type)
00339         {
00340           if (SMPL_PORT_USER_BCAST == port)
00341           {
00342             /* guarantee a match... */
00343             pAddr1 = pCInfo->peerAddr;
00344           }
00345           else
00346           {
00347             pAddr1 = MRFI_P_SRC_ADDR(&wPtr->mrfiPkt);
00348           }
00349         }
00350 #ifdef ACCESS_POINT
00351         else if (RCV_RAW_POLL_FRAME == rcv->type)
00352         {
00353           pAddr1 = MRFI_P_DST_ADDR(&wPtr->mrfiPkt);
00354         }
00355 #endif
00356 
00357         addr12Compare = memcmp(pAddr1, pAddr2, NET_ADDR_SIZE);
00358         if (  (RCV_NWK_PORT == rcv->type) ||
00359               (!pAddr3 && !addr12Compare) ||
00360               (pAddr3 && !memcmp(pAddr3, MRFI_P_SRC_ADDR(&wPtr->mrfiPkt), NET_ADDR_SIZE))
00361            )
00362         {
00363           if (wPtr->orderStamp < oldest)
00364           {
00365             if (fPtr)
00366             {
00367               /* restore previous oldest one */
00368               fPtr->fi_usage = uType;
00369             }
00370             oldest = wPtr->orderStamp;
00371             fPtr   = wPtr;
00372             continue;
00373           }
00374           else
00375           {
00376             /* not oldest. restore state */
00377             wPtr->fi_usage = uType;
00378           }
00379         }
00380         else
00381         {
00382           /* not a match. restore state */
00383           wPtr->fi_usage = uType;
00384         }
00385       }
00386       else
00387       {
00388         /* wrong port. restore state */
00389         wPtr->fi_usage = uType;
00390       }
00391     }
00392     else
00393     {
00394       BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(intState);
00395     }
00396   }
00397 
00398   return fPtr;
00399 }
00400 
00401 /******************************************************************************
00402  * @fn          nwk_getQ
00403  *
00404  * @brief       Get location of teh specified frame queue.
00405  *
00406  * input parameters
00407  * @param   which   - INQ or OUTQ to get
00408  *
00409  * output parameters
00410  *
00411  * @return      Pointer to frame queue
00412  */
00413 frameInfo_t *nwk_getQ(uint8_t which)
00414 {
00415   return (INQ == which) ? sInFrameQ : sOutFrameQ;
00416 }
